results.ground_truth: When engine cranks but won't start, check these in order of likelihood: (1) Fuel system - verify fuel level and pump operation, test fuel pressure at 40-50 PSI [Citation: Para 1-2.1, Table 1-1]. (2) Ignition system - test for spark at plugs [Citation: Para 1-2.3]. (3) Air intake - inspect for severe restrictions [Citation: Para 1-2]. WARNING: Fuel system under pressure, wear eye protection [Safety Notice 1-A].

results.ground_truth: Test alternator charging: Connect voltmeter to battery terminals, start engine and increase RPM to 2000. Voltage should read 13.8-14.4V. Below 13.8V indicates alternator not charging. Above 14.8V indicates regulator failure - turn off engine immediately and disconnect battery [Citation: Para 4-2.2, Table 4-1]. WARNING: Overcharging above 14.8V can cause battery explosion [Safety Notice 4-A].

results.ground_truth: Code P0420 indicates 'Catalyst System Efficiency Below Threshold' - the catalytic converter is not operating at required efficiency [Citation: Para 6-2]. Possible causes: (1) Catalytic converter degradation (most common), (2) Oxygen sensor failure, (3) Exhaust leak before catalyst, (4) Engine running too rich [Citation: Para 6-2]. Verify by monitoring O2 sensor operation - downstream sensor should be steady around 0.45V; if it fluctuates like upstream sensor, converter has failed [Citation: Para 6-2.2].

results.ground_truth: Oil change intervals: Normal conditions - 5,000 miles or 6 months. Severe conditions - 3,000 miles or 3 months [Citation: Para 7-2]. Severe conditions include frequent short trips under 5 miles, extreme temperatures, dusty/off-road driving, trailer towing, or commercial use [Citation: Para 7-1].

results.ground_truth: Yes, this is a safety-critical condition. Brake pedal sinking to floor indicates probable master cylinder failure (60% probability) or external fluid leak (30% probability) [Citation: Para 3-2]. Check brake fluid level immediately - low fluid is an emergency condition [Safety Notice 3-B]. If master cylinder failure confirmed, vehicle must be towed - do not attempt to drive as brake failure can occur without warning [Safety Notice 3-C].

results.ground_truth: Fuel pressure should be 40-50 PSI at idle [Citation: Table 1-1, Table 5-1]. Test using pressure gauge at fuel rail test port with key ON, engine OFF [Citation: Para 1-2.2]. Under wide-open throttle, pressure should remain above 35 PSI minimum [Citation: Table 5-1].

results.ground_truth: To test thermostat: Start engine from cold and monitor upper radiator hose temperature. Hose should become hot when temperature gauge reaches 195°F (thermostat opening temperature) [Citation: Table 2-1]. If hose stays cold, thermostat is stuck closed and preventing coolant circulation [Citation: Para 2-2.2].

results.ground_truth: Code P0171 'System Too Lean (Bank 1)' indicates engine running with insufficient fuel or excessive air [Citation: Para 6-3]. Possible causes: (1) Vacuum leak at intake manifold or brake booster hose, (2) Mass airflow sensor contamination, (3) Weak fuel pump or clogged filter, (4) Faulty oxygen sensor, (5) Exhaust leak before O2 sensor [Citation: Para 6-3]. Diagnose by checking for vacuum leaks first (listen for hissing, spray carburetor cleaner around gaskets), then inspect MAF sensor [Citation: Para 6-3.1, Para 6-3.2].

per_sample_scores.reference: Test alternator charging: Connect voltmeter to battery terminals, start engine and increase RPM to 2000. Voltage should read 13.8-14.4V. Below 13.8V indicates alternator not charging. Above 14.8V indicates regulator failure - turn off engine immediately and disconnect battery [Citation: Para 4-2.2, Table 4-1]. WARNING: Overcharging above 14.8V can cause battery explosion [Safety Notice 4-A].

per_sample_scores.response: {"notes": "LLM unavailable/hung; provided retrieval-only summary with citations.", "sources": [{"page": 18, "source": "vehicle_manual.txt"}, {"page": 16, "source": "vehicle_manual.txt"}, {"page": 20, "source": "vehicle_manual.txt"}], "summary": ["From vehicle_manual.txt p18: PSI Fuel Pressure (WOT) 35 PSI minimum Pump Flow Rate 30 GPH minimum Filter Replacement 15,000 miles --- PAGE 18 --- Component Specification Injector Resistance 12-16 ohms Tank Capacity 16 gallons SECTION 6: DIAGNOSTIC TROUBLE CODES Para 6-1: OBD-II Code Overview On-Board Diagnos", "From vehicle_manual.txt p16: at door placard specification Correct any low tires Monitor MPG for one tank [Citation: Para 5-2.1] --- PAGE 16 --- Step 2: Scan for diagnostic codes Connect scan tool to OBD-II port Check for codes P0420, P0171, P0174 These indicate fuel mixture or catalyst issues [Citation: Par", "From vehicle_manual.txt p20: tep 2: Inspect MAF sensor Remove sensor from air intake tube Examine sensing element for oil or dirt --- PAGE 20 --- Clean with MAF sensor cleaner only (do not use other solvents) Allow to dry completely before reinstalling [Citation: Para 6-3.2] Step 3: Test fuel pressure Connec"]}
per_sample_scores.reference: Code P0420 indicates 'Catalyst System Efficiency Below Threshold' - the catalytic converter is not operating at required efficiency [Citation: Para 6-2]. Possible causes: (1) Catalytic converter degradation (most common), (2) Oxygen sensor failure, (3) Exhaust leak before catalyst, (4) Engine running too rich [Citation: Para 6-2]. Verify by monitoring O2 sensor operation - downstream sensor should be steady around 0.45V; if it fluctuates like upstream sensor, converter has failed [Citation: Para 6-2.2].

per_sample_scores.reference: Yes, this is a safety-critical condition. Brake pedal sinking to floor indicates probable master cylinder failure (60% probability) or external fluid leak (30% probability) [Citation: Para 3-2]. Check brake fluid level immediately - low fluid is an emergency condition [Safety Notice 3-B]. If master cylinder failure confirmed, vehicle must be towed - do not attempt to drive as brake failure can occur without warning [Safety Notice 3-C].

per_sample_scores.reference: To test thermostat: Start engine from cold and monitor upper radiator hose temperature. Hose should become hot when temperature gauge reaches 195°F (thermostat opening temperature) [Citation: Table 2-1]. If hose stays cold, thermostat is stuck closed and preventing coolant circulation [Citation: Para 2-2.2].

per_sample_scores.response: {"notes": "LLM unavailable/hung; provided retrieval-only summary with citations.", "sources": [{"page": 18, "source": "vehicle_manual.txt"}, {"page": 16, "source": "vehicle_manual.txt"}, {"page": 20, "source": "vehicle_manual.txt"}], "summary": ["From vehicle_manual.txt p18: PSI Fuel Pressure (WOT) 35 PSI minimum Pump Flow Rate 30 GPH minimum Filter Replacement 15,000 miles --- PAGE 18 --- Component Specification Injector Resistance 12-16 ohms Tank Capacity 16 gallons SECTION 6: DIAGNOSTIC TROUBLE CODES Para 6-1: OBD-II Code Overview On-Board Diagnos", "From vehicle_manual.txt p16: at door placard specification Correct any low tires Monitor MPG for one tank [Citation: Para 5-2.1] --- PAGE 16 --- Step 2: Scan for diagnostic codes Connect scan tool to OBD-II port Check for codes P0420, P0171, P0174 These indicate fuel mixture or catalyst issues [Citation: Par", "From vehicle_manual.txt p20: tep 2: Inspect MAF sensor Remove sensor from air intake tube Examine sensing element for oil or dirt --- PAGE 20 --- Clean with MAF sensor cleaner only (do not use other solvents) Allow to dry completely before reinstalling [Citation: Para 6-3.2] Step 3: Test fuel pressure Connec"]}
per_sample_scores.reference: Code P0171 'System Too Lean (Bank 1)' indicates engine running with insufficient fuel or excessive air [Citation: Para 6-3]. Possible causes: (1) Vacuum leak at intake manifold or brake booster hose, (2) Mass airflow sensor contamination, (3) Weak fuel pump or clogged filter, (4) Faulty oxygen sensor, (5) Exhaust leak before O2 sensor [Citation: Para 6-3]. Diagnose by checking for vacuum leaks first (listen for hissing, spray carburetor cleaner around gaskets), then inspect MAF sensor [Citation: Para 6-3.1, Para 6-3.2].
